name: AB-YZ
description:
The AB-YZ cipher...

The challenge here is merely to implement the encoding of the AB-YZ cipher. 

The cipher is so named because it uses the position of the letter in the alphabet relative to the previous letter in order to encode data.
First make the letters that should be encoded into a series of bytes and then iterate through every bit. For the first bit if it is 0 add the letter A to the result and if it is 1 add the letter B to the result.
For the second bit add the letter Y to the result if the value of the bit is 0 and otherwise add the letter Z to the result.
Then for the third bit if the value is 0 add C to the result otherwise you should add D and so on for the rest of the input.
When either end of the alphabet is reached it should loop around to the other side.
Any values that are not a part of the alphabet should simply be passed along directly to the result.

example:

abc -> bycwethsipkomlpkrhsgudxc
